title: Demi Lovato says they are nonbinary and changing their pronouns
body: Demi Lovato says they are nonbinary and changing their pronounsBy Rob Picheta, CNNUpdated 5:46 PM ET, Wed May 19, 2021 JUST WATCHEDLovato reveals they are nonbinary, changing their pronounsReplayMore Videos ...MUST WATCH (15 Videos)Lovato reveals they are nonbinary, changing their pronounsKate Hudson snips off boyfriend's ponytailVideo: 'SNL' cold open goes over new mask rulesEmotional Ellen DeGeneres announces her show is endingChild reporter who interviewed Obama has died at 23Michael Jordan reveals last the text message from Kobe BryantKareem Abdul-Jabbar on NBA's new Social Justice Champion AwardWoman wakes days after surgery with different accentJoan Rivers' luxurious (and haunted?) NYC penthouse lists for $38MBillie Eilish admits wearing Billie Eilish wig on talk showSydney Sweeney scolds internet trolls on InstagramDylan Dreyer of "Today" reveals her pregnancy with bun-themed videoRob Gronkowski says he could beat Tom Brady at cornhole and hopes fans return to stadiumsWatch: Former Obama speechwriter trolls Newsmax anchor live on TVRare purple-pink diamond could break auction record (CNN)Singer Demi Lovato has revealed they are nonbinary and are changing their pronouns, telling fans they are "proud" to make the change after "a lot of self-reflective work." Lovato, who rose to fame as a teenage movie star and has become one of the world's most popular singers over the past decade, made the announcement to fans in a video and tweets posted online on Wednesday.Every day we wake up, we are given another opportunity & chance to be who we want & wish to be. I've spent the majority of my life growing in front of all of you... you've seen the good, the bad, & everything in between. pic.twitter.com/HSBcfmNruoâ€” Demi Lovato (@ddlovato) May 19, 2021 "I feel that this best represents the fluidity I feel in my gender expression, and allows me to feel most authentic and true to the person I both know I am and still am discovering," the singer said.Lovato added they came to the decision "after a lot of healing and self-reflective work."Charles Grodin, 'Midnight Run' and 'The Heartbreak Kid' star, dead at 86"I'm still learning & coming into myself, & I don't claim to be an expert or a spokesperson. Sharing this with you now opens another level of vulnerability for me," Lovato said.Read More"I'm doing this for those out there that haven't been able to share who they truly are with their loved ones. Please keep living in your truths & know I am sending so much love your way."The "Sorry Not Sorry" hitmaker recently shared their personal struggles with mental health and addiction in a YouTube documentary, which followed their journey prior to and following a near-fatal overdose in 2018. Demi Lovato: 'I am too gay to marry a man right now' "My doctors said that I had five to 10 more minutes," Lovato says in the documentary, speaking about the incident.In a subsequent interview with EW, Lovato said ending their engagement to actor Max Ehrich helped them understand they are "just too queer" for such a commitment to a man at the moment."Regardless if drama is happening or not, I am too gay to marry a man right now," Lovato said. "I don't know if that will change in 10 years and I don't know if that'll never change, but I love accepting myself."CNN'S Lisa Respers France contributed reporting.Lovato reveals they are nonbinary, changing their pronounsKate Hudson snips off boyfriend's ponytailVideo: 'SNL' cold open goes over new mask rulesEmotional Ellen DeGeneres announces her show is endingChild reporter who interviewed Obama has died at 23Michael Jordan reveals last the text message from Kobe BryantKareem Abdul-Jabbar on NBA's new Social Justice Champion AwardWoman wakes days after surgery with different accentJoan Rivers' luxurious (and haunted?)
